sprite.name: Fuzzy
sprite.notes: Nybbles 19-20 seem to be about speed or tracks. Actor: 0x149

value.title: Flag
value.comment: _Not tested_.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: _Not tested_.

checkbox.title: Move Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Makes the fuzzy move clockwise.

checkbox.title: Big
checkbox.comment: Makes the fuzzy bigger.

value.title: Midway Point No.
value.comment: For if you want more than one checkpoint.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Broken)
value.comment: Defunct; sprites sway even if event isn't triggered.

list.title: Pre-Rotation
list.comment: On level load, sprites will jump to a position as if they had already rotated this many degrees, then they will start rotating.

value.title: Speed of Rotation
value.comment: 0 doesn't sway. Higher values are faster.

value.title: Delay
value.comment: Delay between swaying clockwise and counterclockwise. 0 is no delay. Higher values take longer.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: 1 seems to be same as 0. 3+ ditto or non-existent.

list.title: Mode
list.comment: 0 it completes rotation specified in Rotation Distance and goes back when event is switched off. 1 it spins constantly at the speed and direction set and when the event is switched on it slows down to a halt then reverses direction. 2 it rotates constantly while the event is on (playing the effect again and again). It is unknown what decides if it stops at the start or end rotation (e.g. if it stops at 0° or 180°). 3 seems to be the same as 2.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: No Starting Rotation at 0. Value that sets an initial Rotation for any controlled Sprite. Upon initial Rotation, it will shift the Sprite (arc * 11.25) degrees per Value. For Coins and Blocks the Starting Rotation Value is doubled, e.g. 4 = 180 degrees

list.title: Swing Arc (Rotation Distance)
list.comment: No swing arc at 0. Distance Value that sets how large its swing arc is. It will swing (arc * 11.25) degrees in each Direction per Value. Unlike the Starting Rotation and both rotations in NSMBW, the value doesn't seem to be doubled for coins and blocks.

sprite.name: Coin
sprite.notes: Notes: Can be bounced by Trampoline Mushroom Platforms and Invisible Trampoline Block when loose. Actor: 0x0cf

checkbox.title: Coin on Layer 2
checkbox.comment: When checked, the coins will appear behind layer 1 tiles.

sprite.name: Coin in Bubble
sprite.notes: Notes: Horizontal movement direction is determined by Mario's position. Moves towards Mario. Actor: 0x0dd

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Appears without "flourish" when on.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: _Needs further testing_. Seems to repeat after 3.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: _Needs further testing_

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: _Not tested_.

list.title: Mode
list.comment: Defines how the coins move. _Not tested_.

One coin moves up and down once

list.title: Behavior
list.comment: The behavior of this rotating coin.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: What triggers the coin activating.

checkbox.title: Falling
checkbox.comment: Is the coin falling? (Paracoin)

list.title: Movement Type (Falling)
list.comment: 0 makes the coin normal, or makes it fall in a straight line. 1 and 2 make the coin into a paracoin, and both are at a different sync.

checkbox.title: Ledge Under Door

sprite.name: Fire Bar
sprite.notes: A bar of fire that rotates in a specified direction.

value.title: Number of Bars
value.comment: Value + 1 High values may cause bars to not spawn.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 1. Number of fire balls.

checkbox.title: Wider Base
checkbox.comment: Makes the base block wider.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: 2 is very glitchy and is not advised under normal circumstances. 1, however, works pretty fine. [Unused]

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.comment: Always used as 1...

list.title: Reward
list.comment: 0 is unused.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: _Not tested_.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: _Not tested_.

sprite.name: Fire Snake
sprite.notes: A snake of fire, that jumps around.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Chainer (If X, do Y)

value.title: Time between Flags
value.comment: 0 is instant, 1 - 15 increases time, 15 is the longest time.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The flag that will activate when the player/enemy is in the location.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: Sets the mode the flag will work in.

list.title: Required Player Form
list.comment: The item/power-up state that the player needs to be in to activate the event.

list.title: Required Player Movement
list.comment: 5=You need to actually ground-pound a surface - not just do the "spin upside-down" bit

value.title: Enemy Watch Location ID
value.comment: The enemy has to be in this location. If this needs to be ignored, check the designated checkbox.

checkbox.title: Ignore Enemy Location
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will ignore the enemy's location.

value.title: Player Watch Location ID
value.comment: The player has to be in this location. If this needs to be ignored, check the designated checkbox.

checkbox.title: Ignore Player Location
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will ignore the player's location.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Multi-Chainer (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)

value.title: End Event ID (Target)
value.comment: The activator will trigger all Flags from the start Flag ID to this Flag ID (including this one). The Value entered here must be larger than the Value entered for 'Start Flag ID'

value.title: Start Event ID (Triggering)
value.comment: The activator will start running when this Flag ID is triggered.

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The delay between flags.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Onscreen
sprite.notes: It activates when it enters the screen.

checkbox.title: Never comes back
checkbox.comment: Used only once, and simply a visual detail used at the beginning of a level. :c

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: When Mario is in this location, the porcupuffers will spawn.

value.title: Respawn Time (Seconds)
value.comment: Time it takes before a new porcupuffer spawns, in seconds.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Purpose unknown

sprite.name: Scuttlebug
sprite.notes: Perhaps has unused values to make it walk around like in NSMBDS?

list.title: Movement
list.entry: Moves down slowly,then goes back up slowly
Falls down,then goes back up slowly

value.title: Unknown 5
value.comment: Used as 1 in 1-A etc

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Repeats after 7.

sprite.name: Goal Pole and Fort
sprite.notes: This sprite is sometimes used on the top block of a 1x10 invisible solid. This might to be a leftover from when this was necessary, or it was just for visualization.

checkbox.title: Secret Exit
checkbox.comment: Turns it into a secret exit, which looks different and makes a different path on the Map if there is a secret there.

sprite.name: Group Controller
sprite.notes: Used to pair multiple sprites so that their movement can be synchronized.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: The ID to use when linking to a group.

checkbox.title: Unknown 6
checkbox.comment: Set to 1 in 3-4 ~ Doesn't seem to change anything

checkbox.title: Upside Down
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will appear upside down.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: 3, 9, 12 and 15 are all empty blocks

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match with a Rotation Controller to cause the Block to move.

sprite.name: Lakitu's Cloud
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x10F Used in Impossible Pack to have non-respawning Lakitu. Seems to display Lakitu a frame or few after spawning. Maybe spawns the JugemBody actor inside the cloud.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Sets which path the fence should follow.

value.title: Row 3 Layout (Bitfield)
value.comment: In a horizontal view, each row is a set of 4. This number converted to binary represents the layout. (0 = no fence, 1 = fence).

value.title: Row 4 Layout (Bitfield)
value.comment: In a horizontal view, each row is a set of 4. This number converted to binary represents the layout. (0 = no fence, 1 = fence).

value.title: Row 1 Layout (Bitfield)
value.comment: In a horizontal view, each row is a set of 4. This number converted to binary represents the layout. (0 = no fence, 1 = fence).

value.title: Row 2 Layout (Bitfield)
value.comment: In a horizontal view, each row is a set of 4. This number converted to binary represents the layout. (0 = no fence, 1 = fence).

checkbox.title: Moves When Touched
checkbox.comment: Determines Starting Behaviour. Values repeat.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: _Further testing needed_. Appears when put on.

value.comment: Never used as anything but "2"

value.title: Width
value.comment: Never used as anything but "2"

value.title: Ending Height

sprite.name: Conveyor Belt Switch

value.title: Width + 1
value.comment: Value 0 is the same as 1.

list.title: Starting Direction
list.comment: All even numbers are Right, and all odd numbers are Left.

value.title: Width + 1
value.comment: Value 0 is the same as 1.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: In blocks.

list.title: Starting Direction
list.comment: Even values are Up, and odd values are Down.

list.title: Style
list.comment: 1 is unused, but works.

checkbox.title: Round Top Edges
checkbox.comment: Makes edges rounder, and makes the platform 1 pixel taller.

value.title: Width (0 is 4 blocks)
value.comment: The width of the platform. Setting it to 0 makes the platform 4 blocks. No other value adds 4 blocks to the width.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Speed of the lift.

list.title: Movement
list.entry: Moves Back When Not On It

sprite.name: Changeable Direction Platform
sprite.notes: It is still at first, it starts moving when landed on. After that it reverses direction when landed on.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Ending)
value.comment: When this flag is triggered, the platform will disappear.

value.title: Starting Direction
value.comment: A value of 10 causes platform to move down, Needs more testing.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Needs an as-of-yet undetermined nybble to be set to 1 for this to work

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Value*1 is added to the Path ID.

value.title: Platform Length
value.comment: Length of the platform.

value.title: Path ID Overflow
value.comment: Value*16 is added to the Path ID.

value.title: Unknown Value 15
value.comment: Always 3.

list.title: Number of Peepas
list.comment: Determines how many peepas will be holding the platform. Values repeat.

list.title: End Behaviour
list.comment: The behavior of the platform after it hits the last node. (* starts at the top, goes down, and disappears.)

list.title: Start Behaviour
list.comment: Determines Starting Behaviour. Values repeat.

sprite.name: Four Platform Rickshaw Lift
sprite.notes: Can move with and without tracks. Can be big or small.

list.title: Size
list.comment: _Not tested_.

list.title: Movement
list.comment: _Not tested_.

value.title: Unknown 1-2
value.comment: Maybe disables when or once on.

value.title: Camera Y Offset
value.comment: Sets how far above/below the limit the camera will render.

checkbox.title: Permeable Camera Limit
checkbox.comment: When Set to 1, the camera will scroll past the border if the player passes it. The interactions with "Camera Stay Above" and "Camera Stay Below" are unclear.

checkbox.title: Camera Stays Above
checkbox.comment: Camera will not go below the sprite when this is equal to 1

checkbox.title: Camera Stays Below
checkbox.comment: Camera will not go higer than the sprite when this is equal to 1

value.title: Camera Y Offset
value.comment: Sets how far above/below the limit the camera will render.

checkbox.title: Permeable Camera Limit
checkbox.comment: When Set to 1, the camera will scroll past the border if the player passes it. The interactions with "Camera Stay Above" and "Camera Stay Below" are unclear.

checkbox.title: Camera Stays Above
checkbox.comment: Camera will not go below the sprite when this is equal to 1

checkbox.title: Camera Stays Below
checkbox.comment: Camera will not go higer than the sprite when this is equal to 1

list.title: Starting Orientation
list.comment: A value higher than 3 causes the game to crash upon loading the sprite.

checkbox.title: Move Counter Clockwise
checkbox.comment: When checked, the spike top will move counter clockwise.

value.title: Camera X Offset
value.comment: Sets how far left/right the limit the camera will render.

checkbox.title: Permeable Camera Limit
checkbox.comment: When Set to 1, the camera will scroll past the border if the player passes it. Needs either "Camera Stays to the Left" or "Camera Stays to the Right" checked.

list.title: Scrolling Limit
list.comment: If "Permable Camera Limit" is checked, the camera will scroll past the limit.

value.title: Camera X Offset
value.comment: Sets how far left/right the limit the camera will render.

checkbox.title: Permeable Camera Limit
checkbox.comment: When Set to 1, the camera will scroll past the border if the player passes it. Needs either "Camera Stays to the Left" or "Camera Stays to the Right" checked.

list.title: Scrolling Limit
list.comment: If "Permable Camera Limit" is checked, the camera will scroll past the limit.

sprite.name: Climbing Koopa - Horizontal
sprite.notes: A koopa that climbs on a fence, horizontally. (left to right, or right to left.)

checkbox.title: Start moving left
checkbox.comment: If unchecked, Starts moving right

checkbox.title: Is on moving fence
checkbox.comment: Check this if the koopa is on a moving fence to prevent weird collision. Using this on a normal fence causes koopa to be invisible

sprite.name: Climbing Koopa - Vertical
sprite.notes: A koopa that climbs on a fence, vertically. (up to down, or down to up).

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: Can be bounced by Trampoline Mushroom Platforms and Invisible Trampoline Block unless in shell. Gold Ring behaviour; turns gold, kicked/thrown shell leaves trail of coins.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Broken)
value.comment: Defunct Triggering Flag that was presumably required for Gold Ring functionality at one point.

value.title: Z-Order Change
value.comment: This makes the Koopa appear on Layer 2.

sprite.name: Pipe Fire Piranha Plant - Down
sprite.notes: A pipe piranha plant that sits in a pipe facing downwards.

sprite.name: Pipe Fire Piranha Plant - Left
sprite.notes: A pipe piranha plant that sits in a pipe facing left.

sprite.name: Pipe Fire Piranha Plant - Right
sprite.notes: A pipe piranha plant that sits in a pipe facing right.

sprite.name: Pipe Fire Piranha Plant - Up
sprite.notes: A pipe piranha plant that sits in a pipe facing upwards.

sprite.name: Pipe Bone Piranha Plant - Up
sprite.notes: Tags: Unused actor Notes: Should be placed on top left corner of pipe Actor: 0x121

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Up
sprite.notes: Notes: Should be placed on top left corner of pipe Existing In-Game Sprite Data: Incorrect

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Broken)
value.comment: Defunct Triggering Flag that was presumably required for Gold Ring functionality at one point.

list.title: Rotation Speed
list.comment: The speed of the Koopa Paratroopas as they rotate. Any values equal to or above 3 return 0.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: The direction the Koopa Paratroopas spin in.

value.title: Circle Radius
value.comment: Value +1.5

value.title: Number of Koopa Paratroopas
value.comment: The number of Koopa Paratroopas in the circle. Value +1

value.title: Koopa 5-8 Gap Position
value.comment: The gap where the player can jump through. Is a bitfield.

value.title: Koopa 1-4 Gap Position
value.comment: The gap where the player can jump through. Is a bitfield.

value.title: Koopa 13-16 Gap Position
value.comment: The gap where the player can jump through. Is a bitfield.

value.title: Koopa 9-12 Gap Position
value.comment: The gap where the player can jump through. Is a bitfield.

list.comment: Coins in circle jump up 1 tile after level fade-in.

value.title: Unknown Nybble 7
value.comment: Always 1. Not tested.

value.comment: Not tested.

list.title: Spikes
list.comment: 7/8 produce messed up hitboxes / repeats after 8

list.title: Mode
list.comment: If 2 it moves the specified tiles to move if the flag is activated and moves back if the flag is deactivated _needs further testing_

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Nintendo uses different types for up/down. Values greater than 7 not tested.

value.comment: Value + 1. If it's 0 the game will set it to 1.

value.comment: Value + 1. If it's 0 the game will set it to 1.

list.comment: Values greater then 4 make the lift not move at all. 4 can be glitchy in certain circumstances.

value.title: Unknown Value 7
value.comment: Always 4...

list.title: Limit Direction
list.comment: Other values not tested

checkbox.title: Upside Down
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will appear upside down.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: 3, 9, 12 and 15 are all empty blocks

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match with a Rotation Controller to cause the Block to move.

list.title: Content
list.comment: 3, 9, 12 and 15 are all empty blocks

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Use this to link red coins to this ring.

list.title: Reward
list.comment: You get a 1-Up if you are big, unless value is 1, then you always get that. Values seem to loop.

value.title: Unknown 6
value.comment: Seems to have a different sync than other red coin rings; not much purpose.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The Gold Ring won't work properly if this is 0 or 255. If you set multiple Gold Rings to the same ID, they will "chain" together, rather than there being a new timer for each Gold Ring.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 4.

sprite.name: Roy Koopa
sprite.notes: Requires a castle boss controller to function correctly.

checkbox.title: Left Side
checkbox.comment: Check this if this is the wall on the left.

list.title: Height
list.comment: Includes head. Value + 3

sprite.name: Camera Controller - "ScrollView"
sprite.notes: Used to shift camera relative to Mario?

sprite.name: Parabomb Cannon
sprite.notes: Does not launch regular Bob-ombs, as they just stick.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: Direction of the cannon.

list.title: Launches
list.comment: Bob-omb does not work correctly. _needs further testing_

checkbox.title: Rotates
checkbox.comment: Changes direction after every shot.

list.title: Launch Type
list.comment: Amount of bob-ombs thrown before a break.

checkbox.title: Is Right Shutter
checkbox.comment: Check if this shutter is the one on the right.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Together with the overflow, this nybble forms the Path ID. It works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 11 here, and 1 at the Path ID overflow.

list.title: Length
list.comment: Value +3

value.title: Starting Path Node (+1)
value.comment: Value +1

value.title: Path ID overflow
value.comment: This nybble works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 1 here, and 11 at the Path ID.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Values of 3 or greater are unused and have no effect.

checkbox.title: Deletes Itself
checkbox.comment: If checked, the snakeblock will delete itself.

checkbox.title: Already Moving
checkbox.comment: When this is checked, the snakeblock will move without the player steping onto it.

list.title: Ending Behavior
list.comment: Sets how the snakeblock should act when reaching the final path node. Values of 6 or greater crash the game.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Together with the overflow, this nybble forms the Path ID. It works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 11 here, and 1 at the Path ID overflow.

list.title: Length
list.comment: Value + 3

value.title: Starting Path Node (+ 1)
value.comment: Value + 1

value.title: Path ID Overflow
value.comment: This nybble works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 1 here, and 11 at the Path ID.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Values of 3 or greater are unused and have no effect.

checkbox.title: Deletes Itself
checkbox.comment: If checked, the snakeblock will delete itself.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: Use this ID to link it to a GroupID (98)

checkbox.title: Already Moving
checkbox.comment: When this is checked, the snakeblock will move without the player steping onto it.

checkbox.title: Ice Snakeblock
checkbox.comment: If checked, the snakeblock will be an ice snakeblock.

list.title: Ending Behavior
list.comment: Sets how the snakeblock should act when reaching the final path node. Values of 6 or greater crash the game.

sprite.name: Star Coin
sprite.notes: 5-12 A2 Z1 has a Star Coin with a nybble 22 of 9 with no linked Rotation Controller. This might be because the sprite ID was changed from that of a Rotation-controlled Star Coin to that of a Star Coin - and the Rotation Controller was deleted.

checkbox.title: Shift Half a Tile Right
checkbox.comment: Shifts the switch half a tile to the right.

checkbox.title: Upside Down
checkbox.comment: Makes the switch upside down.

checkbox.title: Reusable
checkbox.comment: Allows the switch to be used multiple times.

checkbox.title: Not Timed
checkbox.comment: Disables the timer on the switch.

checkbox.title: Gravity Affected
checkbox.comment: Causes the switch to fall if nothing is below it.

checkbox.title: Move when Touched
checkbox.comment: Nybble with mask 2. Makes the fence so Mario has to activate it before it starts moving.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction the fence starts moving in.

sprite.name: Resources Loader - Applause Coin
sprite.notes: Needed for the applause coin to work, place at the start of the level.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.comment: Always 1...

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Always 1...

sprite.name: "KoopaLastFire"
sprite.notes: I assume this is spawned by some actor in or before the battle with Giant Bowser or Giant Dry Bowser.

value.title: Unknown Event ID
value.comment: _Not tested_.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: _Not tested_.

value.title: Type
value.comment: Sets the type of platform to spawn. Values of 3 or higher will cause the game to crash.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Always 1.

sprite.name: Bowser Head Statue - Big Bowser Battles

value.title: Strange Field
value.comment: Only moves on flag trigger if this=2

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Always 2

sprite.name: Big Coin Meteor
sprite.notes: The large coin flying in all rainbow levels

list.title: Coin Value
list.comment: Determines the value of the coin. Values after 1 are repeated.

list.title: Direction Of Movement
list.comment: Determines the direction the coin will move in.

value.title: Y Position Offset
value.comment: Offsets the Y position by +2 blocks for each value.

value.title: Speed (Horizontal)
value.comment: 0 Is slowest, 15 is fastest.

value.title: Speed (Vertical)
value.comment: 0 Is slowest, 15 is fastest.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Always 2...

list.title: Platform Width
list.comment: Makes platform 4 tiles wide instead of two.

sprite.name: Peach for Credits
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x199 Existing In-Game Sprite Data: 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 6-27 A1

sprite.name: Spore Effect
sprite.notes: Makes spores appear in front of the level, like the lava and snow effects.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This is a required field in order to make this move.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance the block moves after activating.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction the block moves after activating.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Seems to be reversed. The smaller the value, the bigger.

sprite.name: Staff Credits - Koopa Clown Car
sprite.notes: Actor: 0x15a Existing In-Game Sprite Data: Incorrect

value.title: Unknown Value 15
value.comment: Always 3

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: Always 1

value.title: Tilt Speed
value.comment: Value Modulo 64. Speed increases for values 1-32, then decreases for values 33-63.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 3.

list.title: Starting Tilt/Tilt Angle
list.comment: In degrees.

value.title: Stem Length
value.comment: Value + 4

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Appeared if on. No "flourish" for appearing/disappearing.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Used in 3-16 as 0 or 1

sprite.name: Ending Birds
sprite.notes:
Existing In-Game Sprite Data: Incomplete No nybbles set
How does this act in a normal level?
